feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial app that produces concrete financial calculations (affordability, payment breakdown, payoff timing) and underwent implementation work (bug fixes, data persistence). Although the student reports some inconsistencies, the tool clearly performs relevant financial tasks and multiple example outputs, meeting the criterion.
- Integrate AI: The submission clearly integrates AI (Gemini) to generate functionality, fix code, and produce concrete financial outputs (e.g., affordability calculation), and the student iteratively improved the tool (IMPLEMENT and REFLECT). Although some inconsistency was noted, the AI integration added substantive capability (conversation memory, persistence, calculations), meeting the standard for a PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "my total monthly payment can be $5,600 which is 28% of uh the 20k that I get monthly."
"And so it rewrote it and um it checked uh and the the syntax error invalid expected token was the error and so it it used JavaScript to to fix these problems."
"With this $56 $5,600 payment um per month, I can pay it off 12 and 1/2 years faster than the original goal with the 100k down payment."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student defined the goal ("goal-based financial tool") and prompted the app to perform financial tasks.  
Implement: student describes debugging and code fixes (JavaScript) and integration (Firestore) to enable multi-step memory and persistence.  
Reflect: student notes inconsistencies and limitations (resetting/memory issues) showing evaluation of the tool's outputs.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial app that produces concrete financial calculations (affordability, payment breakdown, payoff timing) and underwent implementation work (bug fixes, data persistence). Although the student reports some inconsistencies, the tool clearly performs relevant financial tasks and multiple example outputs, meeting the criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "And so it rewrote it and um it checked uh and the the syntax error invalid expected token was the error and so it it used JavaScript to to fix these problems."
"And so with this amount, with my down payment of 100 grand...the maximum affordable house uh is $848,000"
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: student stated the goal and choice of AI ("So I used Gemini.")
- Implement: student described AI-assisted code fixes and functional additions (rewrote code, fixed syntax errors, added conversational memory/data persistence)
- Reflect: student evaluated outputs and noted inconsistencies and improvements (discussed multi-step memory and data persistence)
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly integrates AI (Gemini) to generate functionality, fix code, and produce concrete financial outputs (e.g., affordability calculation), and the student iteratively improved the tool (IMPLEMENT and REFLECT). Although some inconsistency was noted, the AI integration added substantive capability (conversation memory, persistence, calculations), meeting the standard for a PASS.
